intro: Ainsliaea fulvioides var. glabriachenia, commonly known as the smooth-leafed ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
